page.title: 08HILL FARMING IN MARSKE AREA.
page.content: STRUCTURE=AS FOR Dairying.(page 5) Hill land-reclemation by drainage, rotovation and reseeding to grassland. Single suckled herds of from 20-150 Friesian cross Hereford cows served by Charollais or Limousin bulls. Summer grazed with calves at foot on rough grazings. 7 month old calves sold to Lowland farms at annual Autumn sales. Cows housed in winter and fed on silage &/or hay with some bought-in feed. Sheep-mainly of Swaledale breed. Home bred, self contained pure flocks with ewes drafted out for sale after 4 crops of lambs. Male lambs sold for fattening in Lowlands. Older ewes crossed with Blue Faced Leicester rams producing breeding females for sale to Lowlands.
